result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

filed by Tina S. from JSC stating DE did not report to JSC when requested.  Includes 21CF521, 22CF443, 22CF455, and 22CF705.  Per SRN on 11/1/22- JA to contact Atty Olson - DE to report by Thursday (11/3) prior to 4 pm or WA will be issued. JA will advise Atty. Olson's Office.  DE did not report to JSC by 11/3 at 4:00, Warrant issued. bph

8:46 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Nicole M. Pilrain not in court.  Attorney Angela Raye Olson in court for Nicole M. Pilrain.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 21CF521, 22CF443, & 22CF455. Set for MH. Court reviews files and notes DE contact JA stating she was in an accident this morning so will not be here for today's hearings. Tina Sitz from JSC is here and states DE has not been set up for SCRAM unit at this time.  Court does not enter Judgment today and will not issue warrant.  Court resets this matter, however DE to appear at JSC by tomorrow at 4:00 PM or a warrant will be issued. Adjourned at 8:50 AM. bph

Victim's petition for bond modification. Filed by DA.  gll       08/03/22 Per SRN, Grants the request of victim to modify the DE bond to remove the condition of no contact with D.A and to include a condition of no abusive contact. arc   fax: SCSO
Filed by Atty Olson. km

Adjustment Number: 22A 066726,
Payable Number: 242702,
Amount: $20.00
Filed by ADA Rockow. km

AMENDED

Includes 22CF455 and 22CF443.

- $500 bond on file.

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least THREE times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, David A or any of his residences.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping. 

- Defendant can retrieve personal belongings from property one time with law enforcement

- If Defendant enters treatment, Defendant to sign appropriate release of information for Justice Support Center.

1:39 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Lindabaur.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicole M. Pilrain in court with Attorney Bush.  Includes 22CF455 and 22CF443. Atty Busch states Atty Olson will be retained- Atty Olson to file Notice of Retainer. Court amends bond to include 22CF443.  gll

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required be fitted with a SCRAM alcohol testing unit and further understand I am to submit to random alcohol testing at least THREE times per day. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

If Defendant enters treatment, she is to sign appropriate release of information for Justice Support Center.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, David A.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:27 PM Atty Harrelson didn't see DE in the jail and didn't get a chance to asses for PD qualification. Court notes Atty Olson is retained on other matters for DE. DE doesn't know if she'll be retaining Atty Olson. Court advises DE to contact PD to see if she qualifies. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Waive reading. Bond argument; bond ordered.  gll
